column4: Im running 11.04 how do I hook up my laptop to my TV via hdmi? Cable is already hooked up, I just can't get my screen to pop up on my TV
xrandr
what is that?
lets you set your monitors how you want resolution location compared to others etc
the current monitors app isnt even recognizing my TV
for example i use xrandr --output LVDS1 --mode 1024x600 --output VGA1 --mode 1440x900 --right-of LVDS1
to get monitor names just type it without arguements
I have ARandR and multiple screens apps from software center. I have no idea how to set them up so I can connect the TV
open a terminal and pastebin output of xrandr with no arguements
make sure your hdmi is plugged in when doing that
does it see anything is plugged into hdmi? theres nothing there
the hdmi cable is plugged into the tv and my laptop and my tv is on the correct HDMI source setting.
does the laptop see the hdmi port?
cause xrandr doesn't :/
can you help me fix it?
lspci do you see your hdmi port listed?
I dont see it in there, no.
Fn+ display button (f5 for me)
press it again when the lcd is off type xrandr again
it could not be using a pci connection...though why hdmi would be on anything else?
try the open source ones...they're usually just as good as the nvidia ones for most things
and they're not proprietary and dependent on nvidia
chromiumos is released on a few devices...sort of a failos though
